page.title: 10TOURISM IN FORRES
page.content: Forres attracts many visitors from both Britain and abroad.It is an ancient town founded almost 2000 years ago so there are many historic features to see.Sueno's Stone on the outskirts of the present town is a sculptured stone erected about 1000 years ago to commemorate a victory, possibly over Norse invaders.In Grant Park,the Witches Stone dates from Pictish times and at the top of Cluny Hill is Nelson's Tower from which extensive views of the area can be seen.There is also a museum,and churches and old houses to visit. The town is famous for its beautiful parks and floral displays.There is a Badminton and Tennis court also a Swimming Pool with a Suana and a Solarium.In all Forres has a wide range of activities for visitors.
